head.title: TAG Aviation Forms Partnership With Cessna

hedline.hl1: TAG Aviation Forms Partnership With Cessna

abstract.p: Cessna Aircraft Co is acquiring 50 percent stake in TAG StarShares Holding and, together with TAG Aviation USA, is forming new company, CitationShares Holding, to serve expanding 'fractional ownership market,' whereby businesses acquire share of airplane rather than buying full ownership (S)

block.p: Cessna Aircraft Company and the Harrison-based TAG Aviation U.S.A. have formed a new company to serve the expanding ''fractional ownership market,'' whereby businesses acquire a share of an airplane rather than buying full ownership.

Cessna is acquiring a 50 percent interest in TAG StarShares Holding to form CitationShares Holding, which will continue to be based at the Westchester County Airport and to market Cessna's Citation jet aircraft.

Cessna Aircraft Company and the Harrison-based TAG Aviation U.S.A. have formed a new company to serve the expanding ''fractional ownership market,'' whereby businesses acquire a share of an airplane rather than buying full ownership.

Cessna is acquiring a 50 percent interest in TAG StarShares Holding to form CitationShares Holding, which will continue to be based at the Westchester County Airport and to market Cessna's Citation jet aircraft.
Gary Hay, Cessna's chief executive said that fractional ownership is the fastest growing segment of business aviation.
The CitationShares' fleet will include the recently certified Citation CJ1 and the Citation Bravo.

Cessna Aircraft Company is a subsidiary of Textron, an $11.6 billion, global, multi-industry company; TAG Aviation is a privately held, Luxembourg-based company with offices in Geneva, Paris, Washington and Riyadh.
